byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati reported from Al Mukalla, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Shuaib Almosawa contributed reporting from Sana, Yemen.
byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Exiled Yemeni government of Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi claims that Saudi-backed fighters have taken control of Aden from Houthi rebels; Houthi leader Abdel-Malik al-Houthi urges his supporters to continue to fight, and residents of Aden report that Houthi fighters still control one neighborhood and are active in others.
lead_paragraph: The exiled prime minister, writing on Facebook, called it a “historic moment” and said his government would turn its attention to repairing the devastation.

headline.main: Saudi-Backed Forces Said to Wrest Aden, Yemen, From Houthis
headline.print_headline: Saudi-Backed Forces Retake Key Yemeni City, Exiled Leaders Say

snippet: The exiled prime minister, writing on Facebook, called it a “historic moment” and said his government would turn its attention to repairing the devastation.
